entries.content: Objections are information requests, not rejections.
entries.notes: Fundamental shift in viewing objections as opportunities to provide more information rather than barriers.

entries.content: When faced with 'I don't recognize any of those problems,' ask 'If I told you we have clients achieving X results, you'd still say you're not interested, right?'
entries.notes: Final attempt to engage by presenting tangible results, phrased as a hypothetical to reduce pressure.

entries.content: Look, you're gonna hate this - it's actually an unsolicited email. You probably want to delete me right now, right?
entries.notes: Email opener that disarms by acknowledging the unsolicited nature upfront, creating curiosity.

entries.content: Prospect says 'We've got it covered' → 'That's what everyone says until they see our solution. Can I ask what specifically you're using currently?'
entries.notes: Technique to uncover current solutions and identify gaps without confrontation.

entries.content: You can't convince anyone of anything - your job is to help them discover they need your solution.
entries.notes: Emphasizes questioning over pitching to guide prospects to self-realization.

entries.content: When asked 'What do you do?', respond with 'If I told you I help eliminate the problems we just discussed, what would you say?'
entries.notes: Redirects focus back to the prospect's stated challenges rather than product features.

entries.content: Based on what we've discussed, do you believe I can help you? [If yes] Can I ask why?
entries.notes: Closing technique that forces prospect to articulate their own buying rationale.

focus_area: Objection Mindset: Objections = info requests, not rejections
